resources:
Defensa lógica Abrir cajón de navegación Cerrar cajón de navegación Acerca de Categorías Una práctica lista de falacias lógicas
Apelando a la mente Apelando a las emociones Deduciendo falsamente Distorsionando causa y efecto Manipulando contenido Atacando
Apelando a una autoridad anónima Apelando a una autoridad Apelando a una práctica habitual Apelando a la ignorancia Apelando a la incredulidad Apelando al dinero Apelando a la novedad Apelando a la creencia popular Apelando a la probabilidad Apelando a la tradición Using evidence from an unnamed \'expert\' or \'study\' or generalized group (like \'scientists\') to claim something is true. Claiming something is true because an (unqualified or untrustworthy) \'expert\' says it is. Claiming something is true because it\'s commonly practiced. A claim is true simply because it has not been proven false (or false because it has not been proven true). Because a claim sounds unbelievable, it must not be true. Supposing that, if someone is rich or something is expensive, then it affects the truth of the claim. Supposing something is better because it is new or newer. Claiming something is true because the majority of people believe it. Assuming because something could happen, it will inevitably happen. Claiming something is true because it\'s (apparently) always been that way. \'They say that it takes 7 years to digest chewing gum.\' \'Over 4000 prominent scientists and engineers dispute global warming.\' \'This bank has some problems with corruption, but there\'s nothing going on here that doesn\'t go on in all other banks.\' \'Nobody has proven to me there\'s a God. So I know there is no God.\' \'The eye is an incredibly complex biomechanical machine with thousands of interlocking parts. How could that exist without an intelligent designer?\' \'If it costs more, it must be better.\' \'Awesome! The latest version of this operating system is going to make my computer faster and better..\' \'Milk is essential for healthy bones.\' \'There are billions of galaxies with billions of stars in the universe, so there must be another planet with intelligent life on it.\' \'The government has always existed, therefore society cannot live without one.\'
Apelando a las consecuencias de una creencia Apelando al miedo Apelando al alago Apelando a la naturaleza Apelando a la compasión Apelando al ridículo <string name="fallacies_titles_2_7"Apelando al rencor Apelando a la ilusión Arguing a belief is false because it implies something you\'d rather not believe. An argument is made by increasing fear and prejudice towards the opposing side. Using an irrelevant compliment to slip in an unfounded claim which is accepted along with the compliment. Making your claim seem more true by drawing a comparison with the \'good\' natural world. Attempt to induce pity to sway opponents. Presenting the opponent\'s argument in a way that makes it appear absurd. Dismissing a claim by appealing to personal bias against the claimant. Suggesting a claim is true or false just because you strongly hope it is. \'That can\'t be the Senator on that sex-tape. If it were, he\'d be lying about not knowing her, and he\'s not the kind of man who would lie.\' \'Before you know there will be more mosques than churches.\' \'Intelligent and sophisticated readers will of course recognise a fallacy like this when they read one.\' \'Of course homosexuality is unnatural. You don\'t see same-sex animals copulating.\' \'The former dictator is an old, dying man. It\'s wrong to make him stand trial for these alleged offenses.\' \'Faith in God is like believing in Santa Claus and the Tooth Fairy.\' \'Don\'t you just hate how those rich Liberal Hollywood actors go on TV to promote their agendas?\' \'The President wouldn\'t lie. He\'s our leader and a good American.\'
Prueba anecdótica Por composición Por división Falacia de diseño Falacia del jugador Generalización precipitada Saltar a conclusiones Punto intermedio Falacia perfeccionista Falacia relativista Centrar la atención Generalización excluyente Medio no distribuido Discounting evidence arrived at by systematic search or testing in favor of a few first hand stories. Assuming that characteristics or beliefs of some of a group applies to the entire group. Assuming that characteristics or beliefs of a group automatically apply to any individual member. Assuming that because something is nicely designed or beautifully visualized, it\'s more valid or better. Assuming a history of independent outcomes will affect future outcomes. Drawing a general conclusion from a tiny sample. Drawing a quick conclusion without fairly considering relevant (and easily available) evidence. Assuming because two opposing arguments have merit, the answer must lie somewhere in between them. Assuming that the only option on the table is perfect success, then rejecting anything that will not work perfectly. Rejecting a claim because of a belief that truth is relative to a person or group. Assuming an observation from a small sample size applies to an entire group. Applying a general rule too broadly. Assuming because two things share a property, that makes them the same thing. \'I\'m going to carry on smoking. My grandfather smoked 40 a day until he died at the age of 90.\' \'Recent terrorist attacks have been carried out by Islamic groups, therefore all terrorists are muslims.\' \'Many Conservatives wish to ban gay marriage, discredit climate change, and deny evolution, therefore all conservatives are homophobic, anti-environment creationists.\' \'Elementary OS is the most well designed and best looking Linux distribution, therefore it is clearly superior.\' \'I\'ve flipped a coin 10 times in a row and it\'s been heads each time, therefore the next coin flip is more likely to come up with tails.\' \'I just got cut up by the woman driver in front. Women can\'t drive.\' \'She wants birth control in her medical cover? What a slut!\' \'I rear ended your car but I don\'t think I should pay for the damage. You think I should pay for all the damage. A fair compromise would be to split the bill in half.\' \'What\'s the point of these anti-drunk driving ad campaigns? People are still going to drink and drive no matter what.\' \'That\'s perhaps true for you, but it\'s not true for me.\' \'This large shoe manufacturer employs children in sweatshops. Therefore all shoe companies are evil child-slave owners!\' \'Those young men rioted because they lacked morally responsible fathers.\' \'A theory can mean an unproven idea. Scientists use the term \'the Theory of Evolution\', therefore evolution is an unproven idea.\'
Afirmando lo consecuente Lógica circular Cum Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc Negando el antecedente Ignorando una causa común Post Hoc Ergo Propter Hoc Dos errores hacen un acierto Assuming there\'s only one explanation for the observation you\'re making. A conclusion is derived from premises based on the conclusion. Claiming two events that occur together must have a cause-and-effect relationship. Also known as \'Confusing Causation with Correlation\' There isn\'t only one explanation for an outcome, so it\'s false to assume the cause based on the effect. Claiming one event must have caused the other when a third (unseen) event is probably the cause. Claiming that because one event follows another, it was also caused by it. Assuming that if one wrong is committed, another wrong will cancel it out. \'Marriage often results in the birth of children, so that\'s the only reason why it exists.\' \'Stripping privacy rights only matters to those with something to hide. You must have something to hide if you oppose stripping privacy rights.\' \'Teenagers in gangs listen to rap music with violent themes. Rap music inspires violence in teenagers.\' \'If you get a degree, you\'ll get a good job. If you don\'t get a degree, you won\'t get a good job.\' \'We had the 60s sexual revolution, and now people are dying of AIDS.\' \'Since the election of the President, more people than ever are unemployed, therefore the President has damaged the economy.\' \'Sure - the conditions in this prison are cruel and dehumanising, but these inmates are criminals!\'
Rescate Ad Hoc Petición de principio Generalización sesgada Sesgo confirmatorio Dilema engañoso Mentira Intensidad engañosa Desviar la atención Pendiente resbaladiza Supresión de pruebas Infalsabilidad Trying to save a cherished belief by repeatedly revising the argument to explain away problems. Hiding other contributory factors and supporting the truth of your claim without any evidence other than the conclusion of your claim. Generalizing from an unrepresentative sample to increase the strength of your argument. Looking only for evidence that supports your argument while ignoring contradicting evidence. Presenting two opposing options as the two options while hiding alternatives. An outright untruth repeated knowingly as a fact. Describing an occurrence in vivid detail, even if it is a rare occurrence, to convince someone that it is a true. Introducing irrelevant material to the argument to distract and lead towards a different conclusion. Assuming a relatively small first step will inevitably lead to a chain of related (negative) events. Intentionally failing to use significant and relevant information which counts against one\'s own conclusion. Offering a claim that cannot be proven false, because there is no way to check if it is false or not. \'But apart from better sanitation, medicine, education, irrigation, public health, roads, a freshwater system and public order.. What have the Romans done for us?\' \'All illegal drugs are harmful - that\'s why they\'re illegal.\' \'Our website poll found that 90% of internet users oppose online piracy laws.\' \'It\'s obvious – 9/11 was an American-government led conspiracy to justify the war in Iraq and Afghanistan. No plane hit the Pentagon. The Twin Towers collapse was a controlled demolition… etc.\' \'We\'re going to have to cut the education budget or go deeper into debt. We can\'t afford to go deeper into debt, so we\'ll have to cut the education budget.\' \'I did not have sexual relations with that woman.\' \'After legalising gay marriage, school libraries were required to stock same-sex literature; primary school children were given homosexual fairy tales and even manuals of explicit homosexual advocacy.\' \'Why should the senator account for irregularities in his expenses? After all, these are senators who have done far worse things.\' \'If we legalize marijuana, more people will start using crack and heroin, then we\'d have to legalize those too.\' \'This Iraqi regime possesses and produces chemical and biological weapons. It is seeking nuclear weapons.\' \'He lied because he\'s possessed by demons.\'
Ad Hominem Peso de la prueba Ad Hominem circunstancial Falacia genética Culpable por asociación Falacia del espantapájaros Bypassing the argument by launching an irrelevant attack on the person rather than their claim. I don\'t need to prove my claim - you must prove it is false. Stating a claim isn\'t credible only because of the advocate\'s interest in their claim. Attacking the cause or origin of a claim, rather than it\'s substance. Discrediting an idea or claim by associating it with an undesirable person or group. Creating a distorted or simplified caricature of your opponent\'s argument, and the arguing against that. \'Anyone that says we should build the Ground Zero Mosque is an American-hating liberal.\' \'I maintain long-term solar cycles are the cause of global warming. Show me I\'m wrong.\' \'A study into the health risks of mobile phones involved mobile phone companies, therefore the study cannot be trusted.\' \'Of course, mainstream liberal media aren\'t going to say Barack Obama is a Muslim.\' \'Oh you want to relax the anti-terrorism laws just like the terrorists want us to do. Are you saying you support terrorism?\' \'You say Israel should stop building settlements on the West Bank in violation of the treaty, so you\'re saying Israel doesn\'t have the right to be a nation?\' Acerca de Ajustes Creado por LukeStoneHm\n2015 Una pequeña aplicación que presenta las falacias lógicas más comunes de forma bonita y concisa.\n\nEsta aplicación es un proyectos de código abierto bajo licencia GPL 2.\n\nPuedes ver el código fuente en GitHub.\n\nhttps://github.com/LukeStonehm/LogicalDefence/
